summary: Introduction to configurable filesystem backends for deep agents, covering backend selection, routing, virtual filesystem implementation, and policy enforcement.

structure.title: Backends
structure.summary: Introduction to configurable filesystem backends for deep agents, covering backend selection, routing, virtual filesystem implementation, and policy enforcement.

nodes.title: Quickstart
nodes.summary: Introduces pre-built filesystem backends for deep agents, including ephemeral, local, durable, and composite options.

nodes.title: Built-in backends
nodes.summary: Overview of built-in backends in LangGraph for file storage, including ephemeral state, local disk, durable store, and composite routing.

nodes.title: StateBackend (ephemeral)
nodes.summary: Describes the ephemeral StateBackend, a built-in backend for storing files in LangGraph agent state, persisting across turns via checkpoints, ideal for intermediate results and managing large tool outputs.

nodes.path: backends > Backends > Built-in backends > FilesystemBackend (local disk)
nodes.title: FilesystemBackend (local disk)
nodes.summary: A local disk backend for file operations with configurable root directory, virtual mode for sandboxing, and secure path resolution.

nodes.path: backends > Backends > Built-in backends > StoreBackend (LangGraph Store)
nodes.title: StoreBackend (LangGraph Store)
nodes.summary: StoreBackend uses a LangGraph BaseStore for durable, cross-thread file storage, ideal for existing LangGraph store setups or LangSmith Deployment.

nodes.title: CompositeBackend (router)
nodes.summary: CompositeBackend routes file operations to different backends based on path prefixes, enabling combined storage like StateBackend and StoreBackend.

nodes.title: Specify a backend
nodes.summary: Explains how to specify a backend for the filesystem middleware in Deep Agent, including direct instances and factory functions.

nodes.path: backends > Backends > Route to different backends
nodes.title: Route to different backends
nodes.summary: Configures a composite backend to route specific namespace paths (e.g., /memories/*) to persistent storage while keeping others ephemeral.

nodes.path: backends > Backends > Use a virtual filesystem
nodes.title: Use a virtual filesystem
nodes.summary: Guidelines and code outlines for building custom backends to project remote or database filesystems (e.g., S3, Postgres) into the tools namespace.

nodes.title: Add policy hooks
nodes.summary: Demonstrates two methods to enforce enterprise policy hooks: subclassing FilesystemBackend or wrapping any BackendProtocol to block writes/edits under specified prefixes.

nodes.title: Protocol reference
nodes.summary: Specifies the required endpoints and supporting types for implementing the BackendProtocol, including file operations and search functions.
